books.title: In Search of Lost Time
books.author: Marcel Proust
books.description: In Search of Lost Time, also translated as Remembrance of Things Past, is a novel in seven parts by Marcel Proust, published from 1913 to 1927. The novel tells the story of Proust's own life as an allegorical search for truth.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.description: Don Quixote is a middle-aged gentleman from La Mancha who sets out to defend the helpless and destroy the wicked, inspired by chivalrous ideals.

books.title: Ulysses
books.author: James Joyce
books.description: Ulysses takes place in and around Dublin on a single day, following Stephen Dedalus, Leopold Bloom, and Molly as they mirror the epic journey of Odysseus.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby, narrated by Nick Carraway, chronicles the mysterious and extravagant life of Jay Gatsby in 1920s Long Island.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: Moby Dick tells the tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale that destroyed his ship.

books.title: Hamlet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.description: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to confront corruption and betrayal following the death of his father.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: War and Peace explores Napoleon’s invasion of Russia and follows several families through love, loss, and the chaos of war.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: The Odyssey recounts Odysseus’s perilous journey home after the Trojan War, filled with adventures and divine interventions.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.description: One Hundred Years of Solitude tells the multi-generational story of the Buendía family in a town where magical realism blends with history.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.description: The Divine Comedy is an epic poem that guides the reader through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, charting the soul’s journey towards God.
